job.title: Debugging a C# Windows Worker Service
job.description:
This shouldn't take long. I have a VS 2022 / C# Windows service that runs perfectly well on the Dev machine, but it is throwing pointer errors when I install and run it on a Windows Server 2022 machine. I am getting the following .NET error: "... Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'path') . . ."

Since the only file that the application is reading -- a log file -- has the correct path on the target machine, it is not clear what the application is seeking. I am suspecting it might be an assembly pointer.

I need to get this thing running today.

customFields.generatedDescriptionAI:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced C# developer to help debug a Windows Worker Service. The project timeline is expected to be less than 1 month.

The ideal candidate should have a strong background in C# development and be familiar with Windows app development. Their main responsibility will be to identify and fix any issues or bugs within the existing codebase. 

To apply for this project, please submit a detailed proposal outlining how you can assist with the debugging process. Include information about your experience with similar projects and any relevant certifications or qualifications.

Additionally, please provide links to past completed projects that demonstrate your expertise in C# and Windows app development. We are particularly interested in seeing examples of your problem-solving skills and your ability to work with complex codebases.

We look forward to reviewing your proposals and finding the right candidate to help us debug our C# Windows Worker Service.
